title: Introduction to React
content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It lets you create reusable components and manage state efficiently.

title: Component Lifecycle
content: React components go through a lifecycle: mounting, updating, and unmounting. Understanding these phases helps optimize app performance.

title: State and Props
content: State is a component's internal data, while props are external inputs passed to a component. Both determine how a component renders and behaves.

title: Hooks in React
content: Hooks let you use state and other React features without writing a class. Common hooks include useState, useEffect, and useContext.

title: React Router
content: React Router enables navigation between views in a React app. It provides components like Route, Link, and Switch for managing routes.
